eg.javatools

Class CreateJar

  • java.lang.Object
    • eg.javatools.CreateJar

  • public class CreateJar
extends java.lang.Object
    The creation of a jar file of a project.

    TODO: the jar is created in the folder containing the class files (packages) which is the classpath. If the class files are located in a subfolder of the project's root folder the jar is additionally copied to the root. How can the destination for the jar be specified?

    • Method Detail

      • createJar

        public void createJar(java.lang.String root,
                      java.lang.String main,
                      java.lang.String packageName,
                      java.lang.String classDir,
                      java.lang.String jarName)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a jar file

        Parameters:
        root - the project's root directory
        main - the name of the main class
        packageName - the name of the package that incluses the main class. Can be the empty String but is not null
        classDir - the name of the subdirectory that contains class files. Can be the empty String but is not null
        jarName - the name for the jar. If jarName is the empty String the name of the main class is used
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if not input can be read in
